meaning: idol; someone you admire or look up to
usage_example: Siya talaga ang lodi ko sa sports.

meaning: very awesome/cool/impressive
usage_example: Ang petmalu ng bagong kanta niya!

meaning: from “power”; encouragement or hype
just kidding (to reduce seriousness of statement)
usage_example: Akala ko ikaw yung nag-luto, charot!

meaning: wish everyone had this good luck or situation
usage_example: May bagong phone siya, sana all!

meaning: I can handle it / it’s okay
usage_example: Don’t worry tungkol dun, keri lang.

meaning: aesthetic; something pleasing to the eye or vibe
usage_example: Ang ganda ng feed mo, sobrang estetik!

meaning: joking around / making fun (light banter)
usage_example: Huwag kang dogshow kasi seryoso kami dito.

meaning: deserve; someone deserves something good or bad
usage_example: Grabe siya nag-trabaho, dasurv niya ang promo.

meaning: extravagant / over the top
usage_example: Ang boogsh ng party nila last night!

meaning: being paranoid / overthinking
usage_example: Totoo bang nadelete ka? Huwag ka nang praning.

meaning: agree / I’m down / I like that
expressing hurt or sympathy (aw + sakit)
let’s go / do it
usage_example: Gora na tayo bago magsara ang cafe.

meaning: boyfriend/girlfriend / partner
best friend / close friend
that’s crazy / unbelievable
close female friend (affectionate) / mum mom-friend
variation of momshie
usage_example: Oy mumshie, ang tagal mong di nakikita!

meaning: short for charot
prefix for feeling
day-to-day; everyday ("ulit") – emergent usage
easily falls in love / emotionally fragile
usage_example: Ang bilis naman ma-fall mo, marupok ka talaga.

meaning: term for attractive person (from English/hip-hop culture) – used in Taglish
got to go / need to leave (text chat) – informal
a riff on “bigay-wana” (“give me”) meaning “let me have this” / “let me be” – emergent
from English; someone who does too much for someone they like – used in Taglish
usage_example: "Uy siya yung longtime naive simp mo."

meaning: from English; means “no lie / seriously” – used in Taglish
from English/AAVE; charisma / ability to attract someone – used in Taglish
usage_example: "Bro may rizz ka naman sa kanila."

meaning: feeling like you’re the star / center of attention
usage_example: May main character energy ka today!

meaning: delusional in a playful way – borrowed global Gen Z slang used in Taglish
column5: pero delulu na siya na may future sila."

meaning: escape/dodge a situation (from hip-hop) – used in Taglish
usage_example: "Ayaw niya bumalik? Skrrt ka na lang."

meaning: from English; to do something exceptionally well – Taglish usage
from English; style/clothes/vibe – Taglish
from English; very tasty / excellent – Taglish
from English; transformation for better – Taglish
usage_example: "Ang glow up mo since high school!"

meaning: doing too much for someone you like – Taglish
what’s the gossip / inside info – Taglish
check the mood/energy – Taglish
shock/disbelief (older but still in convo) – Taglish
variation slang phrase meaning “I don’t like you / leave me alone” – informal
usage_example: Ayaw ko sa iyo, tara skrrt ka na.

meaning: borrowed/reverse slang (older but may still surface) – “ganun dog” backwards – emergent
short for “eto” but stylized / playful – emergent
true/real – Taglish
funny made-up word for lame/not cool – emergent/meme context
excitedly wigging out – emergent youth slang
very funny – Taglish abbreviation “as f…” – informal
usage_example: Ang kwela AF ng class namin!

meaning: one of my followers/following – borrowed English internet slang – Taglish
fear of missing out – used in Taglish/English mix
joy of missing out – Taglish mix
right/straightforward (from English “right”) – Taglish
gossip / casual chat
just me showing off – Taglish
usage_example: "Flex ko lang itong bagong bag ko."
